context_bundle.summary: Frontier closed-source models December 2025: GPT-5.2, Claude Opus 4.5, Gemini 3 Pro, Grok 4.1 - capabilities, positioning, and competitive dynamics.

onboarding.quick_start: OpenAI: GPT-5.2 (general), o3 (reasoning), 800M weekly users. Anthropic: Claude Opus 4.5 (intelligence), Sonnet 4.5 (balanced). Google: Gemini 3 Pro (multimodal), deep product integration. xAI: Grok 4.1 (fast iteration). All pivoting to reasoning + agentic capabilities.
common_patterns: === OPENAI ===
GPT-5.2: Current flagship general model. Strong across tasks.
o3: State-of-art reasoning model. Variable compute modes.
o3-mini: Faster, cheaper reasoning. Good cost/performance.
GPT-4o: Previous flagship. Still excellent value.
GPT-4o-mini: Budget option. $0.15/$0.60 per M tokens.
SCALE: 800 million weekly ChatGPT users (Dec 2025).
ENTERPRISE: 320x YoY growth in reasoning token consumption.
STRATEGY: Reasoning models as differentiator. Enterprise focus.
CODE RED: Sam Altman internal alarm over Gemini 3 competition.
=== ANTHROPIC ===
CLAUDE OPUS 4.5: Most intelligent model. Best for complex reasoning.
CLAUDE SONNET 4.5: Balanced model. Best for most production use.
CLAUDE HAIKU 4.5: Fast, cheap. Good for high-volume, simple tasks.
POSITIONING: Enterprise focus. Safety-first approach.
DIFFERENTIATOR: Constitutional AI, computer use, coding excellence.
COMPUTER USE: Screenshots, mouse, keyboard control. Unique capability.
STYLE: More thoughtful, nuanced responses. Less sycophantic.
=== GOOGLE ===
GEMINI 3 PRO: Flagship model. Strong multimodal.
GEMINI 3: Base model. Good general performance.
GEMINI FLASH: Speed-optimized. For latency-sensitive applications.
INTEGRATION: Deep hooks into Search, Workspace, Android.
ANTIGRAVITY: Agentic coding platform. Competes with Cursor/Copilot.
CLAIM: 72% answer accuracy (marketing figure, take with salt).
ADVANTAGE: First-party data from Search, Gmail, Docs. Training edge.
GROK 4.1: Major upgrade. Reasoning, safety, emotional intelligence.
SPEED: Fast iteration cycle. Quick to ship updates.
PRICING: Competitive with OpenAI. Slightly cheaper.
INTEGRATION: X (Twitter) integration. Real-time information.
DIFFERENTIATOR: Less restrictive content policies. Humor.
=== CAPABILITY COMPARISON ===
REASONING: o3 > Claude Opus > Gemini 3 Pro > GPT-5.2
CODING: Claude Sonnet â‰ˆ GPT-4o > Gemini > Grok (subjective)
MULTIMODAL: Gemini 3 Pro > GPT-4o > Claude > Grok
SPEED: Haiku/Flash > o3-mini > Sonnet > Opus
VALUE: DeepSeek V3.2 >> all closed models (10x cheaper)
=== CONTEXT WINDOWS ===
GPT-5.2: 128K tokens
CLAUDE OPUS/SONNET: 200K tokens
GEMINI 3 PRO: 1M+ tokens (longest)
GROK 4.1: 128K tokens
TREND: Longer context becoming standard.
=== MULTIMODAL CAPABILITIES ===
VISION: All support image input. Quality varies.
AUDIO: GPT-4o, Gemini support audio. Others limited.
VIDEO: Gemini best. Others limited or none.
GENERATION: Image generation via DALL-E (OpenAI), Imagen (Google).
=== AGENTIC CAPABILITIES ===
OPENAI: Plugins, browsing, code interpreter, function calling.
ANTHROPIC: Computer use (beta), tool calling, MCP support.
GOOGLE: Workspace integration, Search grounding, Antigravity.
XAI: X integration, web access, basic tool calling.
=== SAFETY APPROACHES ===
OPENAI: RLHF, content filters, usage policies.
ANTHROPIC: Constitutional AI, most conservative approach.
GOOGLE: Standard RLHF, content policies.
XAI: Less restrictive, more permissive content policies.
=== ENTERPRISE FEATURES ===
ALL: Custom deployments, data privacy, compliance certifications.
OPENAI: Azure OpenAI Service for enterprise.
ANTHROPIC: Amazon Bedrock, Google Cloud partnerships.
GOOGLE: Vertex AI for enterprise deployment.
=== PRICING TIERS ===
CONSUMER: ChatGPT Plus ($20/mo), Claude Pro ($20/mo)
PROFESSIONAL: ChatGPT Team, Claude Team
ENTERPRISE: Custom pricing, volume discounts
=== MARKET POSITION ===
OPENAI: Market leader by users. Brand recognition.
ANTHROPIC: Quality leader. Enterprise preference.
GOOGLE: Distribution advantage. Product integration.
XAI: Challenger. Fast iteration. Less restrictive.
=== THREATS ===
OPEN SOURCE: DeepSeek matching benchmarks at 10x lower cost.
COMMODITIZATION: Base capabilities becoming commodity.
REGULATION: EU AI Act, US framework increasing compliance burden.
COST PRESSURE: Race to bottom on API pricing.
known_errors: BENCHMARK GAMING: All vendors optimize for benchmarks. Real-world performance varies.
MARKETING CLAIMS: 'Best at X' claims are often cherry-picked scenarios.
VERSIONING CONFUSION: Model versions change frequently. 'GPT-4' means different things over time.
CAPABILITY VARIANCE: Same model can perform differently on similar tasks. Test empirically.
ENTERPRISE GAP: Enterprise features often lag consumer announcements.
PRICING CHANGES: API prices change frequently. Verify before planning.
